question.title: Deactivate KeyListener delay Java
question.body:
I have written a small program with a JLabel in it and as soon as I press W / A / S / D the label moves. The problem is that when I press and hold W for example, the label only moves one pixel and then continues to move until I release it again. Is there a way to deactivate this delay?

this is my code

private boolean oben,unten,links,rechts;

@Override
public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {


    if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_W) oben = true;
    if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_S) unten = true;
    if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_A) links = true;
    if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_D) rechts = true;

    updatePlayerPosition();}

@Override
public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e) {

}
@Override
public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {
        if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_W) oben  =false;
        if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_S) unten =false;
        if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_A) links =false;
        if (e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_D) rechts=false;
        updatePlayerPosition();
}

public void updatePlayerPosition(){
    int neueX = coordienaten_player_x;
    int neueY = coordienaten_player_y;

    if (oben) neueY -= 5;
    if (unten) neueY += 5;
    if (links) neueX -= 5;
    if (rechts) neueX += 5;
    // Teste die neue Position auf Kollision
    player.setBounds(neueX, neueY, 50, 50);

question_comments.body: Short answer: call updatePlayerPosition() from a javax.swing.Timer's ActionListener, not from a key listener.
As an aside, you may want to use if else constructs or switch blocks to avoid needless testing.
To which delay are you referring? Please clarify your question.

First, learn to use markdown to format your posts. Next, take the tour and read How to Ask. I very much doubt whether anyone will be able to help you based on the code snippets in your question. I suggest that you edit your question and post a minimal reproducible example. I also suggest that you post an animated GIF that illustrates the behavior you are describing.
